A healthy 24-year-old male presents with a sore throat for 2 days. He reports mild congestion and a dry cough. On examination, his temperature is 37.2°C (99.0°F).

His pharynx is red without exudates, and there are no anterior cervical nodes. His tympanic membranes are normal, and his chest is clear.

Which of the following is your next step?
opt1: Treat with analgesics and supportive care
opt3: Perform a throat culture and begin treatment with penicillin
